definition:
**The Fourier-Stieltjes algebra of a groupoid, $G_l$**. In ref.
[@PALT2k3]), A.L.T. Paterson defined the *Fourier-Stieltjes algebra of a
groupoid*, $G_l$, as the space of coefficients $\phi = (\xi,\eta)$,
where $\xi,\eta$ are\
$L^{\infty}$-sections for some measurable $G_l$ -Hilbert bundle
$(\mu,\Re,L)$. Thus, for $x \in G_l$,
$$\phi(x) = L(x) \xi (s(x),\eta (r(x))).$$ Therefore, $\phi$ belongs to
$L^\infty{G_l} = L^\infty({G_l},\nu)$.

[9]{} A. Ramsay and M. E. Walter, Fourier-Stieltjes algebras of locally
compact groupoids, *J. Functional Anal*. **148**: 314-367 (1997).

A. L. T. Paterson, The Fourier algebra for locally compact groupoids.,
Preprint, (2001).

A. L. T. Paterson, The Fourier-Stieltjes and Fourier algebras for
locally compact groupoids, (2003).
